# ActionIdentifier

**Structure**

A type that stores the designation code for one of the actions that a vehicle feature supports.

## Declaration

```swift
struct ActionIdentifier
```

## Overview

An [doc://com.apple.CarKey/documentation/CarKey/ActionIdentifier] type wraps a vehicle-specific code you define. This code — known as the action identifier — corresponds to an action your vehicle can take for a particular feature. For example, you might define actions to lock or unlock the vehicle’s doors. Use this type in conjunction with a specific [doc://com.apple.CarKey/documentation/CarKey/FunctionIdentifier] type to specify the complete action you want to perform on a vehicle.

## Creating the Action Identifier

- **init(rawValue:)**: Creates and returns a new action identifier with the specified value.
- **init(_:)**: Creates and returns a new action identifier with the specified value.

## Getting the Value

- **rawValue**: The raw value that corresponds to the feature-specific action.

## Vehicle Actions

- **RemoteKeylessEntryAction**: An automatically ending action that you want to perform on a vehicle.
- **RemoteKeylessEntryEnduringAction**: An action with an optional stopping point that you want to perform on a vehicle.
- **FunctionIdentifier**: A type that stores the designation code for one of your vehicle’s features.

## Conforms To

- Equatable
- Hashable
- RawRepresentable
